captions.text: I'm Boris Galuzin and this is How to choose Used Motorcycle

Gorilla earned money
It is not enough on a new bike
So I'm going to help to choose used one
I start with the inspection of the engine

Check the crankcase joints
If there is a sealant, covers and part were removed
Look at the bolts, you will see if they were unscrewed
Example of loosen bolts
Check traces of welding and oil spills on crankcase
If side covers are damaged, it's not bad, they are damaged even at slight crash
If engine was repaired or removed, I don't buy this bike
If engine is OK - start it

Immediately after starting the engine 
Attach a damp cloth to the muffler
If any cylinder works intermittently, wet spot will evaporate slower
If all cylinders work good - open the throttle to listen to engine, after engine warms up

To check wheels lift the bike
You can do it without stand
Scroll wheel to evaluate backlash and evenness
Check the rim, it should not have dents and scratches
Example of dent
Check fork tubes, it should be straight with no dents
Inner tube shouldn't have rust and scratches
If there is oil, fork seal have to be replaced
Check lower triple clamp
If handlebar limiter is broken, it was hard crash
Therefore carefully check the alignment of the wheel with handlebar

Make sure that there is no play in the steering column
Block from brake and shake the bike
If there is a backlash, you feel a pulsation of bearing
Check the frame
Usually cracks and dents can be found on steering column, sliders or cage mounts, welds
Stand back a few feet and check the alignment of subframe with frame
Check headligth and upper stay
They are very fragile and sometimes break under heavy shake
Check radiator mounts, They are very fragile and dent even after slight crash
Honeycombs of radiator should be smooth and clean
Don't forget to check frame number with documents

If motorcycle is equipped with the immobilizer, it should be service key
Without service key you can't make duplicate
Check electronics
Make sure that the controls do not scroll as retainers often break when crash
Look in tank, there should be no rust
Remove seats to check subframe and wires
There is no original tool kit
This bike has 11700km
It can be verified in two ways
Significant wear of brake rotors appears after 30000-40000km
There is no wear here
Original sprocket kit life is about 30000km
This bike has honest  mileage
Check tires and brake pads
In this case rear tire should be changed
This bike is in good condition, there are only a few cosmetic defects
There are some accessories
Grips, easy-pull clutch, adjustable brake lever, double bubble screen, good slip on
I don't recommend gorilla such powerfull bike as first motorcycle
But it does not listen
Subscribe, if information was interesting!

title: Осмотр Мотоцикла с Пробегом - How to Choose Used Motorcycle
